title: The Girl I Like Has A Boyfriend – Love & Sex Stuff
description:
Submit your questions here!:
http://www.kindafunny.com/loveandsex


But what is she already has a boyfriend? This week Tim and Nick dive into the horrible world of homebreaking.

Each and every Monday at 9AM PST Tim Gettys and Nick Scarpino answer your questions about dating and relationship advice....cause that sounds like a good idea.


Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Nick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_Scarpino



Music by Tonedeff - http://www.QN5.com

transcript_chunks.text: today's question comes from 17-year-old ben yes he says there this girl at my school named Cassie who I've known for years but become good friends with this year we have three classes together in which we talk a lot and have a lot of fun together and I have feelings for her I thought she felt the same way and was going to ask her out but then I figured out that she's already dating someone I want to tell her how I feel but I'm concerned about what it will do to our friendship if she does not share my feelings I think we have great chemistry and make a good couple should I ask her out knowing that she isn't available and hope she picks me or do I wait and hope she becomes single that's a tough one I don't think it's tough at all this is a bad thing home wrecking is bad do not do this ben look it's like this you're in high school she might like you but the fact of the matter is she's someone else's girl right now and we have one rule on this channel we only have one yeah and Tim what

look, it's like this, you're in high school, she might like you, but the fact of the matter is, she's someone else's girl right now. And we have one rule on this channel: we only talk about stuff that's not your girlfriend. Get shot, man! Are you in the friend zone? You have to ask yourself that question. Okay, that is the most important question, and it's a very, very important skill to hone when you're young because it will save you a lot of time and emotion. When you guys are chatting back and forth and hanging out, does she view this as a friendship or relationship? And you know in your heart, really look in your heart and ask yourself that question. And if the answer is yes, you're in the friend zone. Get out! Evacuate the Dance Floor - I don't even think you need to go that far. Garcia, yeah, here's the biggest issue I have with all of this, and that's if it were to work out, your entire relationship would be based on the fact that you just convinced a girl—the girl that you're with—to leave someone else to be with you. And guess what? If it happens to you, it can happen again to you, and that's all bad because you don't want your entire relationship to be based on "home wrecking," such a bad standard. The other thing too is when you're 17, bro, there are so many other people out there that you could be dating, and that's what you should be looking at—you should be looking at who else you can date, not who you can get to leave someone else for you. And also sometimes it's nice to just meet other people, spend some time with them, maybe it doesn't work out, maybe it's not she's the one for you, and then maybe Cassie is available, and it works out.
